conclusion: Summarize the problem setup and what needs to be found.
The image shows three hemispherical bodies labeled A, B, and C. Bodies A and B are in contact with the ground and with each other. Body C is placed between A and B, with all bodies at rest.
Calculate the Center of Mass (COM) for Bodies A and B using their masses and positions.
Determine the normal force F required to counteract the weight of A and B such that their COM is in equilibrium.
Calculate the frictional force f using the maximum static friction formula.
The magnitude of the normal force F exerted by the ground on A is 3mg, and the magnitude of the frictional force f is (sqrt(3)/2)mg.
